title: Email Communications Between Floyd County Manager Jamie McCord and Marjorie Taylor Greene

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I request access to and copies of all email communications between Floyd County Manager Jamie McCord and Marjorie Taylor Greene for the period from April 3, 2020, to the present. This request includes any emails sent to, received from, or copied (cc or bcc) to Marjorie Taylor Greene.

In support of this request, I refer to the following case laws:

Atlanta Journal & Constitution v. City of Atlanta, 259 Ga. App. 818 (2003): This case held that public records requests must be granted in a reasonable amount of time under the Georgia Open Records Act.

Harris v. Cox Enterprises, Inc., 256 Ga. 299 (1986): This case held that records in the possession of a public officer or agency are subject to the Open Records Act, and any exceptions to disclosure must be narrowly construed.

Hardaway Co. v. Rives, 262 Ga. 631 (1993): This case established that when a record is subject to disclosure, the custodian of the record must allow the requester to inspect the record without delay.

Please provide these records in a readable electronic format, such as PDF, and include all email attachments and metadata associated with the requested email communications.

If any portion of this request is denied or exempt from disclosure, please cite the specific exemption and provide an index of the withheld or redacted records, as required by law.

Please be advised that any attempt to withhold or delete responsive documents will be appealed in a court of law. I also request that any responsive records be provided on a rolling basis, meaning that records should be provided as they become available instead of waiting for all records to be collected before responding to the request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jordan

title: Email Communications Between City Manager Sammy Rich and Marjorie Taylor Greene

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I request access to and copies of all email communications between City Manager Sammy Rich (srich@romega.us) and Marjorie Taylor Greene for the period from April 3, 2020, to the present. This request includes any emails sent to, received from, or copied (cc or bcc) to Marjorie Taylor Greene.

In support of this request, I refer to the following case laws:

Atlanta Journal & Constitution v. City of Atlanta, 259 Ga. App. 818 (2003): This case held that public records requests must be granted in a reasonable amount of time under the Georgia Open Records Act.

Harris v. Cox Enterprises, Inc., 256 Ga. 299 (1986): This case held that records in the possession of a public officer or agency are subject to the Open Records Act, and any exceptions to disclosure must be narrowly construed.

Hardaway Co. v. Rives, 262 Ga. 631 (1993): This case established that when a record is subject to disclosure, the custodian of the record must allow the requester to inspect the record without delay.

Please provide these records in a readable electronic format, such as PDF, and include all email attachments and metadata associated with the requested email communications.

If any portion of this request is denied or exempt from disclosure, please cite the specific exemption and provide an index of the withheld or redacted records, as required by law.

Please be advised that any attempt to withhold or delete responsive documents will be appealed in a court of law. I also request that any responsive records be provided on a rolling basis, meaning that records should be provided as they become available instead of waiting for all records to be collected before responding to the request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jordan

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Voluntary recognitions, January 1, 2023 - March 31, 2023
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide  records sufficient to determine the number of voluntary employee union recognitions from January 1, 2023  through March 31, 2023. If available, please provide records about individual recognition with such fields as employer, location, description of bargaining unit, union, and size of unit, and any other non-exempt fields on Form NLRB-5581.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Forest Gregg
